thread.title: Donald Trump poses with Vince and Linda McMahon at the White House | Metro News
thread.title_full: Donald Trump poses with Vince and Linda McMahon at the White House | Metro News

author: Martin Hines For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Donald Trump poses with Vince and Linda McMahon at the White House | Metro News
text:
Martin Hines for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 4:15 pm Trump with Vince and Linda McMahon 
Although Donald Trump has effectively become the Happy Days ‘Jumping The Shark’ episode of politics, his actions are still causing a great deal of bemusement for the general public. Bayern Munich 5-1 Arsenal player ratings: Ozil & Iwobi go missing as Gunners crumble again 
Trump’s latest moment of bemusement has occurred after former WWE CEO Linda McMahon was confirmed by the Senate to run the federal Small Business Administration. 
Linda donated millions of dollars to Trump during his Presidential campaign, and her generosity has been rewarded with a place in his cabinet. Congratulations to our new Administrator of the Small Business Administration, Linda McMahon! Swearing-in: https://t.co/4b678mp3Vo pic.twitter.com/SKAF9YmEPT 
— President Trump (@POTUS) February 14, 2017 
McMahon was voted in by Trump, but it’s not the polling which is making people amused, but this photograph of the entire McMahon family including Shane, Stephanie, Vince and Triple H along with the President. 
Look very closely, and you can see a picture of Trump shaving the head of Vince McMahon at Wrestlemania in 2007. 
Trump had put his hair on the line against Vince, and the two each chose a wrestler to represent them in the match. 
After McMahon picked Umaga, Trump chose Bobby Lashley who won the match and ensured that it was Vince’s hair which would be shaved. 
That Wrestlemania broke all previous box-office and PPV records because of the eagerly anticipated match, and Trump himself was not safe from destruction on the show as he was stunned by guest referee Stone Cold Steve Austin. 
WWE’s affiliation with Donald Trump has lasted for nearly 30 years. Two Wrestlemania events were hosted at his venues, while he unofficially took over Raw in 2009, causing stock to fall. 
After being inducted into the WWE Hall of Fame in 2013, many thought that Trump had said goodbye to the world of over-the-top theatrical pageantry, but his successful foray into politics has perhaps proved that a cartoon world is the only one he truly knows. 
What other President would celebrate professional wrestling during his time in office? More
